NIOP-E, Sta. 776: Seychelles, N of Poivre Island; 5°42'S 53°18'E; calcareous gravel: Halimeda deposit and small rhodolites, depth: 42-45 m; 2.4 m Agassiz trawl; 31.XII.1992.
NIOP-E, Sta. 714: Seychelles, NE of Aride Island; 4°10'S 55°44'E; muddy sand bottom, depth: 55 m; 2.4 m Agassiz trawl; 19.XII.1992.

NIOP-E, Sta. 797: Seychelles, Platte Island atoll; 05°49'S 55°21'E; lagoon of inner atoll; depth 12 m; scuba diving; on gorgonid Rumphella aggregata (det. L. van Ofwegen); 7.i.1993; collected by C.H.J.M. Fransen.

NIOP-E, Sta. 774: Seychelles, Desroches atoll, SW rim; 5°43'S 53°37'E; outer reef slope; depth 20 m; scuba diving; on Antipatharia together with P. lepidus; 30.xii.1992; collected by C.H.J.M. Fransen.

NIOP-E, Sta. 723: Seychelles, Bird Island, off N coast; 3°42'S 55°12'E; coral reef, near drop-off, depth 25 m; scuba-diving; on Antipathes myriophylla Pallas, 1766 (id. D. Opresko, 2000); 21.xii.1992; collected by C.H.J.M. Fransen.

NIOP-E, Sta. 612: Seychelles, Mahé, E coast, Cap Maçons /Anse de Forbans; 04°46'S 55°31'E; depth 5 m, tidal reef flat and slightly declining reef slope; snorkeling; between branches of Acropora coral;12.xii.1992; collected by C.H.J.M. Fransen.
NIOP-E, Sta. 759: Seychelles, St Joseph atoll, S rim; 5°27'S 53°21'E; reef slope, depth: 10 m; scuba diving; between corallites of Galaxea fascicularis; 28.xii.1992; collected by C.H.J.M. Fransen.
NIOP-E, Sta. 677: Seychelles, Mahé Island, between Villa Carol and L'Ilot, 4°33.5'N 55°26'E; large rocks, patches of coral and many Lopha's; scuba-diving, depth 13 m; 13.i.1993.
NIOP-E, Sta. 788: Seychelles, Alphonse atoll, SE part of lagoon; 7°02'S 52°44'E; reef flat and patch reefs, down to 8 m; snorkeling & scuba diving; 4/6.i.1993; in Pinctada margaritifera pearl-oyster.

ncrsGatheringSites.abcd:Locality: between Cap Manuel and Pointe Bernard
ncrsGatheringSites.abcd:LocalityText: Senegal, southern tip of Cape Verde Peninsula, between Cap Manuel and Pointe Bernard. Between concrete stairs and swimming pool of Lido Hotel, boulder beach down the cliffs, with submerged barrier of boulders, merging into sandy bottom at 4-6m.
